lines.text:
[frantically searching through fortunes]
They can break your cookie, but... you'll always have your fortune.
Look, if you're going to accept what they think of you, then you can leave. I almost did.
Well, you should have. Life here for animals is the pits. We're always playing the scapegoat.
Quickly forgotten.
Working for scale.

Then why are you still here? Because you can't get over that feeling, can you? That feeling you get when... when you two dance together. When you play. When you sing. They cursed you, humilliated you, even slammed the door on your face, but they haven't made you forget. Have they?

Did you know the peanut is not a nut at all? And not a pea, for that matter. It's rather odd that we call it a nut because it isn't a nut, you see. It's actually a member of the legume family. How about pea-legume? No, that doesn't make any sense, either. But whatever it is, it makes a splendid tea.

[in movie]
Yea, as you walk through your valley of despair, fear not. For I am your little Ark Angel, and I will look after each and every little, teensy-weensy, itsy-bitsy one of you!
[crowd "awww"s]
Shoot me.
I'm the star, you stupid, stupid cat! I should have drowned you all when I FLOODED THE STAGE!

[echoing over the PA]
Flooded the stage!... flooded the stage!... flooded the stage!
Darla Dimple! I can't believe it.
[Darla tries to act sweet, then Pudge opens a trap door under her]

[as she falls down the trap door]
MAAAAAAX!

[on the Darla balloon, floating over Paris]
Oui, Miss Dimple?
Well, there's always Broadway. Yeah, Broadway. I hear hippos are very, very big on Broadway.
They're big everywhere, Darling.
If we all work together, we can make our dreams come true. Let's show the world what we can do.

[clenching Danny in his grip]
How does the kitty cat go?
Meow?
Very Gooood.
Look, tiger. This town has rules. Around here cats say, "Meow."
But that's so old hat. I'm sure no one would mind if I jazzed this up a bit.
Okay, learn it the hard way.

[dramiatic reading]
Meow!
[as Gabby Hayes]
Meow! Dagnabit, meow!
[as Edward G. Robinson]
Meow, see? Yeah, that's it. Meow! Meow!
There's no use trying. Last night my fortune cookie said, "Give it up - you loser!"

[singing]
I've seen 'em come and I've seen 'em go / There's one thing that I know / You gotta give the people what they want / Or you'll wind up back in Kokomo, Nebraska.
Uh, Indiana, Ms. Dimple.
...Whatever.
Looks like we'll be the only two cats on the ark. Isn't that great?
So much for preserving the species!
Gee whiz, Mr. Mammoth, what's the secret of your success?
Simple! It's Dimple!
[Sawyer enters, wet and disheveled]
Sawyer, what happened to you?
Did you walk under a ladder? Smash a mirror?
Have you looked in one lately?
No, a cat crossed my path.
Really? Orange tabby?
Yes.
Green vest?
Uh huh.
Straw hat?
Yes.
Oh, what a coinky-dink!
How did you know?
Oh, hippo's intuition.
Flannigan, the title of this picture is "Li'l Ark Angel"... ISN'T IT!
Yes... yes.
And who in here is an angel?
Mmmm... mmmm?
I SAID WHO IN HERE'S AN ANGEL?
Why, you are, Darla, sweetheart, celebrity, darling...
[Darla pulls on Flannigan's tie]

[choking]
ACK... angel!
That's right! I AM an angel! I... am... an adorable... little... ANGEL!
But I thought Hollywood was always looking for new talent.
Ah, ah, talented *people*, not animals.
[sighs]
You see, the spotlight will never be on fellows like you and me, and it's foolish to think otherwise, Danny.
Look who's back! I wish he had himself stuffed!
I know a divine taxidermist, darling. Did my first husband.
What if I could get you an audition with L.B. Mammoth?
L.B. Mammoth? Head of Mammoth Studios?
I'm sure he'd appreciate good talent.
After nothing but Darla, he's gotta be starving for it!
I... hate... *animals!*
[pointing to Danny]
Especially that one!
You animals will never...
...nibble kibble in this town again!
Look at you standing there with the long, long face.

[to another horse]
Hey, he must be talking to you.
I hear Farley Wink gets good parts for animals.
If you call hanging from a hook a good part.
Wow! My own dream come true.
10% of that dream is mine.
They like it big, they like it loud / Maybe a little bit jazzy sometimes / Mister Pussycat, listen to me / You don't have to be good, but you had better be...
Get hot, Miss Dimple.
Big and Loud! / Big and Loud! / Wanna make your mamma proud / Make it big / And / Loud!
I would have slugged that big lug Max for you, but I didn't want to hurt the guy.

[after Pudge lands on the piano keys]
That's it! B-flat. You have a natural rear for music, little fellow.
Well, well. Run of the soundstage, use of Darla's ark, costumes... I don't know. Something seems fishy.
I beg your pardon?
Sorry. It's just that I smell a rat.
Excuse me?
Oh, never mind.

[singing]
I didn't get where I am today / By getting myself get pushed around / No man nor beast / Nor kitty cat nor doggie / Is going to bring me down.
Mwa-ha-ha-ha-ha!
Shut up, Max.
Look at them. I'm ashamed to be an animal.
Oh, shut up, you old nanny, and show old Frannie what you got.
Well?
I can't do this.
And?
I can't do this.
So?
I can't believe I'm doing this.
Sometimes I ask myself, "Why do I put up with this?"
The glamour?
What, this pig sty? No offense, Harry.
None taken.
Unless you're talking about the glamour of filing, the romance of typing.

Now, the people they were so bad / That the Lord made the rain come down / And He washed away the bad cities, and He washed away the bad towns / And all of the people drowned / With the animals it was different, though some of them drowned too / The others were just poor animals, and they didn't know what to do / So... I built a little ark / As cute as it can be / And I put all the animals two by two / On my little boat on the sea.
Ah, the recipe for a Darla Dimple movie. Begin with one part adorable character in jeopardy.
[inside the soundstage, Darla has tied up Pudge]
Sorry, penguin, but in everyone's life, a little rain must fall. Max, man the valves!
Yes, Miss Dimple.
[Max opens the water valves]
Add two parts plucky determination...
More water, Max. More water!
Sprinkle in an air of innocence...
More rain, Max! We must have rain!
Stir in with...
More water!
Add a pinch of...
Thunder!
And an itsy-bisty dash of...
Lighting! Ah-ha-ha-ha!
Mix them all together, and what do you get?
[The stage doors open, revealing a flooded stage which then spills out into the lot]
Say, what happened back there?
Look, I...
Did I hit a sour note? Because if I hit a sour note, I can go back and... I can fix it.
Danny, they don't care! Don't you get it? What's the matter with you? Why are you so determined on making a fool of yourself?
What do you mean? All I want to do is the thing I love. Doesn't everyone?
It's not that simple.
It is in Kokomo.
Then... maybe that's where you should have stayed.
[after finishing "Big & Loud", to a stunned Danny]

[in cutesy voice]
Kinda makes you speechless...

[in sultry voice]
... don't it?
